intro: Bupleurum commutatum f. laxum, commonly known as the lax leaf form of the common thorned bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, pinnatifid leaves that are often more loosely arranged compared to the typical form. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in compound umbels. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
